intro: Haworthia johanii, commonly known as the Johan’s Haworthia, is a small, compact succulent native to South Africa. It features dense rosettes of fleshy, blue-green leaves with white markings and translucent windows, which aid in photosynthesis. The plant produces short, upright flower stalks with white or pale yellow flowers during the spring or summer. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for rock gardens or container cultivation. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
